alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 08 at 6:15PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Haskell. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 613 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. The heaviest up to 3 inches has fallen near Sagerton...as was spreading northeast toward Haskell. This is causing arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Haskell, Rule, Irby, Sagerton and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... County Road 274 crossing Brushy Creek, crossings along County Road 247 and County Road 279 crossing North Paint Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
